The correct answer is A: Because the eclipse path reaches Australia, and the narrator jokes that even kangaroos will enjoy it; people in parts of Australia will see a partial eclipse.

The audio clip describes an animated kangaroo looking up at the sun and then the moon during an event on the year 2023. This is likely due to the fact that Australia will experience a partial eclipse during this time, which means that people in certain parts of the country will be able to witness the moon passing in front of the sun. The narrator is also joking about how even kangaroos might enjoy the eclipse since they are native to Australia and would be able to see it happening in their own backyard.

The answer is A: The orange ring and maps depict an annular solar eclipse crossing from near Canada into South America; a separate partial lunar eclipse is mentioned for Europe, Asia, Africa, and parts of Australia around Halloween weekend, prompting the spooky sound.
